channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for SC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for SC

item.title: Report X-2023120202
item.description:
Report X-2023120202

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-27
  • City: GREENVILLE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Delivery driver brought back package to station. It was in a plastic bag inside of a tote. Package was discovered by an Ops Admin. Ops Admin alerted Ops Manager. Ops Manager put on PPE, placed damaged contents and damaged box in a Damaged HazMat bag and placed in a Damaged HazMat tote. Tote was brought to the Damaged HazMat cage for storage until it could be processed. DescribePack: Cap came loose on one of the jerricans and leaked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Bagged, placed in tote and brought to the Damaged HazMat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023120061
item.description:
Report X-2023120061

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: SPARTANBURG
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FOUND INSIDE TRAILER WET. HAZMAT-CERTIFIED ADMIN NOTIFIED OF LEAKING HAZMAT PACAKGE. DescribePack: JERRICAN LEAKED FROM UNDER CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: HAZMAT-CERTIFIED ADMIN USING PROPER PPE REORIENTED THE PACKAGE INSIDE A LINED HAZMAT TOTE AND SECURED THE TOTE INSIDE THE HAZMAT CAGE.
